roleset.name: go along with
roleset.note: ACCOMPANY-V NOTES: Member of VNcls accompany-51.7. (from accompany.01-v)
ACCOMPANIMENT-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to accompany.01-v. Accompany.01 is a member of VN class accompany-51.7. Framed by Katie. (from accompaniment.01-n)

example.name: active
example.text: The figure was incorrectly shown as a net loss in a chart accompanying Friday's Heard on the Street column.
example.arg: Friday 's Heard on the Street column

example.name: passive
example.text: Mr. Dempsey estimated that [the issue's London debut]-1 was accompanied *trace*-1 by ``very, very heavy turnover -- between five million and six million shares.''
example.arg: by ``very, very heavy turnover -- between five million and six million shares

example.name: with start and end point, verbnetted
example.text: John led the unhappy group of travellers from the frying pan to the fire.

example.name: aftershocks are accompanying the earthquake
example.text: Following the big quake was an accompaniment of aftershocks of varying sizes stricking at random, along with stormy adverse weather conditions.
example.arg: of aftershocks of varying sizes stricking at random along with stormy adverse weather conditions.

example.name: literal start and end
example.text: the piano's accompaniment from start to finish
